property.value: The Attic Whisperer is immune to the Mental and Poison traits. Before the encounter, each character at your location must succeed at a Wisdom 4 check or be dealt 1 Mental damage which may not be reduced; players must choose a blessing to discard as their damage, if they have any.
Encounter Bruthazmus twice. Bruthazmus is defeated or undefeated based solely on the results of the second encounter. If defeated, you may immedately attempt to close this location.
"Oooh, a trespasser! Impress me with your groveling, and maybe I'll let you leave with one of your eyes." --Erylium
Before the encounter, choose a character at your location and encounter a Wrathful Sinspawn henchman. If undefeated, succeed at a Wisdom or Divine 8 check or move to a random other location.
If the Giant Hermit Crab would be defeated, reroll the dice. The Giant Hermit Crab is defeated or undefeated based solely on the results of the second die roll.
Before the encounter, succeed at a Wisdom or Perception 6 check or bury 1 random card from your hand.
If undefeated, succeed at a Constitution or Fortitude 8 check or discard the top card of your deck.
After the encounter, the Goblin Pyro deals 1 Fire damage to you.
Each character at an open location summons and encounters a Goblin Raider henchman; banish this card.
If undefeated, bury 1 item or weapon of your choice from your discard pile. If defeated, you may immediately attempt to close your location.
Before the enounter, succeed at a Constitution or Fortitude 6 check or the diffuculty of your checks is increased by 1 for the rest of the turn.
Before the encounter, succeed at a Wisdom 8 check or you may not play spells with the Attack trait or weapons.
"Get 'em Tangletooth! Chomp 'em faces 'til they all outta faces to chomp!" --Gogmurt, to his firepelt cougar Tangletooth
Before the encounter, Gogmurt deals 1d4-1 Fire damage to you. You may not play allies with the Animal Trait. All damage from Gogmurt is Fire damage.
If undefeated, after the encounter, Korvus deals 1d4 Acid damage to each character at this location. If defeated, you may immediately attempt to close your location.
Before the encounter, Lyrie Akenja deals 1d4-1 Fire damage to you. If defeated, you may immediately attempt to close your location.
If you succeed at the check to defeat the Monster in the Closet, summon and encounter a Goblin Raider henchman. If you do not defeat the Goblin Raider, the Monster in the Closet is undefeated.
"Get your filthy eyes off of me! A simpleton like you will never understand the beauty of the Mother of Monsters!" --Nualia
Before the encounter, Nualia deals 1d4 Force damage to each character at this location. For each blessing played in a check against Nualia, the difficulty of the check is increased by 2.

If defeated, succeed at a Charisma 5 check to search this location deck and choose a boon to add to your hand, then shuffle the location deck. If defeated, you may immediately attempt to close your location.

Draw 3 items from the box. You may choose 1 and add it to your hand; banish any not chosen. If you added one to your hand, each character at this location is dealt 1d4+1 Fire damage. After the encounter, banish the Pit of Malfeshnekor.
"Got big crown, got big knives, Got big gems for goblin wives! Me big chief, him big gecko, Nugget make your face a wreck-o!" --Chief Ripnugget's goblin song
Before the encounter, succeed at a Stealth 9 check or the difficulty to defeat Ripnugget is increased by 2.
(Stickfoot) Combat
(Ripnugget) Combat
If defeated, you may immediately explore again. If undefeated, reset your hand and end your turn.
If undefeated, every character at this location is dealt 1d4 Combat damage.
Each character at this location encounters Tangletooth. If any character does not defeat Tangletooth, she is undefeated. If defeated, you may immediately attempt to close this location.

"After what we heard up on the roof--the clomping and snorting and that terrible, terrible tearing--I ain't ashamed to say I kept right here between the sheets and didn't even thing about coming out till morning. We lost three cows and my favorite porker that night.
"I still feel like we got off easy." -- Account of Missy Rundell, Sandpoint Farmer
After the encounter, banish The Sandpoint Devil.
Before the encounter, succeed at a Wisdom or Survival 7 check or the difficulty to defeat the Tickwood Boar is increased by 2.
The difficulty of checks to defeat Tsuto with the Attack or Ranged traits is increased by 2. If defeated, you may immediately attempt to close this location.
Before the encounter, Succeed at a Wisdom 6 check or the difficulty of your checks is increased by 1 for the rest of the turn. If defeated, you may immediately attempt to close this location.
Before the encounter, each character at your location must succeed at a Wisdom 6 check or the difficulty of your checks is increased by 1 for the rest of the turn.
Banish this card to reduce damage dealt to a character at your location by 3. Banish this card to succeed at your check to acquire a weapon, an armor, an item or a spell.
Banish this card to add 1d6 to your check. Banish this card to return a card from your discard pile to your hand.

For your combat check, reveal this card to roll your Strength or Melee die + 1d10+1; you may additionally discard this card to add another 1d10. If you aren't proficient with weapons, the difficulty of this check is increased by 4.
Discard this card to add 1 die to a check. Discard this card to add 2 dice to a check to defeat a monster. Discard this card to explore your location.
If the top card of the blessings discard pile matches this card, recharge it instead of discarding it.
Recharge this card to add 1d6 to your check to acquire an ally. Banish this card to return an ally from your discard pile to your hand.

For your combat check, reveal this card to roll your Dexterity or Ranged die + 1d4+1; you may additionally recharge this card to add another 1d4. When playing another weapon, you may discard this card to add 1d4+1 to the combat check.

For your combat check, reveal this card to roll your Strength or Melee die + 1d6; you may additionally discard this card to add another 1d6. If any d6 rolled for this weapon is a 1, count it as a 3, then discard this card.

For your combat check, reveal this card to roll your Strength or Melee die + 1d6+1; you may additionally discard this card to add another 1d6. If any d6 rolled for this weapon is a 1, count it as a 3, then discard this card.
Heavy Armor Magic Elite

Reveal this card to reduce Combat damage dealt to you by 2. Banish this card to reduce all damage dealt to you to 0; if you are proficient with heavy armors, bury this card instead. If you are proficient with heavy armors, you may recharge this card when you reset your hand.
Light Armor Magic Elite

Reveal this card to reduce Combat damage dealt to you by 1. Banish this card to reduce all damage dealt to you to 0; if you are proficient with light armors, bury this card instead. If you are proficient with light armors, you may recharge this card when you reset your hand.
Discard this card to evade a monster; return it to the top of the deck. If you do not have the Arcane skill, banish this card.
Succeed at an Arcane 8 check to recharge this card instead of discarding it.
Discard this card to add 1d4 with the Fire trait to a combat check using a weapon. If you do not have either the Arcane or Divine skill, banish this card.
Succeed at an Arcane or Divine 8 check to recharge this card instead of discarding it.
For your combat check, discard this card to roll your Arcane die + 2d6 with the Cold trait. If you do not have the Arcane skill, banish this card.
Succeed at an Arcane 8 check to recharge this card instead of discarding it.
Bury this card to add 1d8 to a combat check at your location. Discard this card to explore your location. If you encounter a boon, banish it.

During your turn, reveal this card and put it on top of your deck to examine the top card of your location deck; if it's a monster, you may shuffle that monster back into the location deck. After you play this card, roll 1d12; on a 1, summon and encounter the villain The Sandpoint Devil.

For your combat check, reveal this card to roll your Dexterity or Ranged die + your unmodified Strength die + 1. If you aren't proficient with weapons, the difficulty of this check is increased by 4. If you are proficient with weapons, you may discard this card to add 1d4+1 to a combat check at another location.
Banish this card and choose a character at your location to succeed at an Acrobatics check.
Banish this card and choose a character at your location to succeed at a Survival check.
For your combat check, discard this card to roll your Arcane die + 2d6 with the Fire trait. If you do not have the Arcane skill, banish this card.
Succeed at an Arcane 8 check to recharge this card instead of discarding it.

If you played a weapon with the 2-Handed trait on this check, you may not play this card. Reveal this card to reduce Combat or Fire damage dealt to you by 2. If you are proficient with light armors, you may play another armor on this check.

For your combat check, reveal this card to roll your Strength or Melee die + 1d6+1; you may additionally discard this card to add another 1d6. If you aren't proficient with weapons, the difficulty of this check is increased by 4.
Discard this card to reduce damage dealt to you by 4.
Succeed at an Arcane or Divine 9 check to recharge this card instead of discarding it.

Display this card and select a character. For the rest of the turn, add 3 to that character's checks that use her Dexterity die. Discard this card at the end of the turn. If you do not have the Arcane or Divine skill, banish this card.
Succeed at an Arcane or Divine 8 check to recharge this card instead of discarding it.
Recharge this card and choose a character at your location to recharge 1 random card from his discard pile.
Bury this card to put a spell from your discard pile into your hand. Discard this card to explore your location.
Banish this card to add a random item from the box to your hand.
For your combat check, bury this card to roll 4d4 with the Arcane and Force traits.
Succeed at an Arcane 8 check to recharge this card instead of burying it.
Bury this card to reduce Combat damage dealt to you by 2.
Succeed at an Arcane 8 check to recharge this card instead of burying it.
Monster 6 Barrier 1 Weapon 1 Spell 0 Armor 0 Item 1 Ally 0 Blessing 0
You may attempt a Wisdom or Perception 7 check to evade a monster.
Summon and defeat a Wrathful Sinspawn henchman.
On closing, you may shuffle an item from your discard pile into your deck.

A sink hole freshly opened in streets reveals the cracked masonry of some ancient but still intact structure hidden just beneath the town. The new opening into the mysterious ruins exposes darkened chambers, jagged runes suggested of demonic hordes, and the crimson glow of something old - but still very much alive - pulsing in the depths
Monster 3 Barrier 1 Weapon 1 Spell 1 Armor 0 Item 1 Ally 2 Blessing 0
If you fail a check, discard the top card of your deck.
Succeed at a Wisdom or Perception 6 check.
No effect.

The glasswork stands at the edge of Sandpoint. Here, artisans use sand and flame to create every sort of glassware, from common windows to elaborate, colored pieces of art. Curtains have been drawn across the buildings numerous windows, and it is curiously silent, although plumes of dark smoke still issue from its many numerous chimneys.
Monster 3 Barrier 1 Weapon 1 Spell 0 Armor 0 Item 2 Ally 2 Blessing 0
The difficulty to defeat monsters with the Goblin trait is increased by 2.
Summon and defeat a Goblin Raider henchman.
On closing, add 1d4 random [X] Weapons to this location without looking at them, then automatically acquire the top card.

Crashes, discordant singing, and manic laughter ringing from the crude walls of this goblin holdfast, a fortress of branches, scrap metal, and garbage as elaborate as it is ramshackle. The bodies of unfortunate travelers, the paint smeared skins of livestock, and a half eaten remains of seagulls serve as warnings of the inhabitants by woodwinds and demented sense of humor.
Monster 2 Barrier 2 Weapon 1 Spell 0 Armor 1 Item 3 Ally 0 Blessing 0
When you acquire an item, you may banish it to draw a random item from the box.
Summon and defeat a Poison Trap henchman.
On closing, add 1d6 random items to this location without looking at them, then automatically acquire the top card.

The stark expansive coast is littered with the debris of shipwrecks and trash dumped from the clips above. The tide constantly drags scraps into the water, but some of the junk heaps will take decades to erode. Amid piles of cast-off barrels, rotten food, wagon parts, and other scrap run the trails of scavengers; some obviously prowl on four legs, and others on two.
Monster 6 Barrier 1 Weapon 1 Spell 0 Armor 0 Item 1 Ally 0 Blessing 0
You may attempt a Wisdom or Perception 9 check to evade a monster.
Summon and defeat a random monster
On closing, you may shuffle an item from you discard pile into you deck.

Dense hedges of words and creeping vines knot into a twisting labyrinth of crawling natural walls. Too dense to push through, the mazes passages bear the evidence of past explorers, such as flaps of torn cloth and bloodstained needles. The thicket doesn't sound empty though, as small things giggle and darts just beyond this wall or that, visible only in glimpses through the brush.
Monster 2 Barrier 1 Weapon 1 Spell 0 Armor 0 Item 1 Ally 2 Blessing 2
At the start of your turn, you may shuffle any number of cards from your hand into your deck and draw 1 fewer card than you shuffled in.
Defeat or acquire the next card in the deck. If there isn't one, you may close this location automatically.
No effect.
Sandpoint's town square is crowded with people. Locals and visitors alike celebrate amid good music and food. But tiny forms slip through the shadows and begin singing an obnoxious song...
At the start of your turn, you may shuffle any number of cards from your hand into your deck and draw 1 fewer card than you shuffled in.
Monster 2 Barrier 1 Weapon 1 Spell 1 Armor 0 Item 1 Ally 3 Blessing 0
If you fail a check to acquire an ally, you may put the ally on the bottom of the location deck.
Succeed at a Charisma or Diplomacy 6 check.
On closing, you may recharge an ally from your discard pile

Laughter, music, and light fill the cozy common room of Sandpoint's most renowned inn. Travelers and locals enjoy warm food and quaff god ale, all the while swapping stories of adventure and the open road. Behind the bar, the Rusty Dragon's owner, Ameiko Kaijitsu, greets each newcomer as a friend with a wave, a wink or a genial welcome.

The goblin raiders might have been defeated, but already they're regrouping in thier lair of sticks and brambles amid the ruins called Thistletop. Strike back against the goblins and find out what's been stirring the disorderly maniacs to attack!
Woods Treacherous Cave Goblin Fortress Nettlemaze Waterfront Guard Tower Prison Garrison
The difficulty to defeat monsters with the Goblin trait is increased by 1d4.
Tangletooth Bruthazmus Goblin Raiders
Each character draws a random weapon from the box

Wielding torches and cackling war songs, goblin raiders dash through the streets of Sandpoint. Find the goblins' ruthless geck-mounted leader, Chief Ripnugget, and unmask their ally in Sandpoint before the miniature maniacs set the entire town ablaze!
Town Square Swallowtail Festival City Gate Sandpoint Cathedral The Rusty Dragon The Old Light Wooden Bridge Desecrated Vault
If you defeat a monster with the Goblin trait, roll 1d6. On a 1, each character at your location takes 1 Fire damage.
Ripnugget and Stickfoot
Tsuto Kaikitsu Goblin Raiders
Each character gains a skill feat.

With celestial ancestry, Nualia was born on the path of light, but a childhood facing the constant attention and fealousy of Sandpoint's people drove her to embrace the demon goddess Lamashtu. Bitter and vengeful, Nualia has taken refuge in the ruins of Thistletop, enlisting the aid of goblins, a band of vicious outcasts, and other mysterious allies in a plot to destroy Sandpoint. Those who would save the town must defend it from her goblin raiders, quall the evils unleashed in the chaos, and then take flight to Thistletop and Nualia herself!
Attack on Sandpoint Local Heroes Trouble in Sandpoint Approach to Thistletop Thistletop Delve
Each character gains a card feat

Everyone in town wants to thank the heroes of Sandpoint for saving them from the recent goblin raid, but you have feeling that darker times are on the horizon. Explore the town, visit its most signficant landmarks, and gather your allies - you'll be needing them!
General Store Woods Waterfront Academy The Rusty Dragon Sandpoint Cathedral City Gate Garrison

If you acquire an ally, you may immediately to close your location. If you fail to acquire an ally, discard the top card of blessings deck.
To win this scenario, close all locations.
1 Random Ally per location
Each character draws a random ally from the box.

Wearing a strange star medallion and raising prayers to the goddess Lamashtu, the vicious fanatic Nualia has been commanding her goblin servants from dungeons beneath Thistletop. Hunt down Nualia and her henchmen before they can unleash greater evils upon Sandpoint!
Throne Room Thassilonian Dungeon Warrens Goblin Fortress Temple Deeper Dungeons Garrison Desecrated Vault
The difficulty of checks to acquire items or weapons is inscreased by 2.
Lyrie Akenja Orik Vancaskerkin Goblin Raiders
Loot: Sihedron Medallion

As cowardly as they are crafty, goblins still lurk in Sandpoint, stirring up trouble. They've even revealed strange ruins beneath the town's streets. Ferret out the last of the goblins and destroy the evil things they've unleashed before someone gets hurt!
Glassworks Catacombs of Wrath Shrine to Lamashtu Village House The Old Light Junk Beach Waterfront Apothecary
After a character encounters a Wrathful Sinspawn henchman, roll 1d6. On a 1, discard the top card of the blessings deck.
Koruvus Wrathful Sinspawns
Each character gains a power feat.
